Each company account can create up to 10 organizations, and access to each organization is strictly permission-based‚Äîonly authorized users can view or manage its cloud data.

  • ‚úÖ Assign clear ownership and visibility across departments
  • ‚úÖ Monitor usage and spending without data overlap
  • ‚úÖ Maintain security while working with internal teams and external partners

With OpsNow, each organization can manage:

  • üí∞ Cloud cost trends and optimization opportunities
  • üìä Resource usage and performance indicators
  • üîê Governance policies and compliance configurations

You can also assign users to different organizations with role-based access controls, helping you maintain data isolation, accountability, and operational efficiency across multi-cloud environments.

What is the difference between deactivating and removing a user account in OpsNow?,difference-deactivate-remove-user-opsnow,6553f2f580e17f32ec1dd65b,6550ba985d0bbc1cfca82427,6554182d71056e9aaa6b59fb,false,false,Wed Nov 15 2023 01:00:29 GMT+0000 (Coordinated Universal Time),Thu May 08 2025 06:36:28 GMT+0000 (Coordinated Universal Time),Thu Jun 26 2025 08:49:43 GMT+0000 (Coordinated Universal Time),"

In OpsNow FinOps Plus, when a user no longer requires access‚Äîdue to offboarding, contract changes, or inactivity‚Äîyou can either deactivate or remove their account.
While both methods serve to protect your organization‚Äôs data, they differ in terms of how the account is handled.

‚úÖ Deactivate: Temporarily restrict access

  • The user account remains in the system, but all service access is blocked.
  • The account can be reactivated later, preserving access history and organizational ties.
  • Best for:
    • Long-term absences (e.g., leave of absence)
    • Temporary suspension of partners or external vendors
    • Internal security audits
      ‚Äç

‚ùå Remove: Permanently delete the account

  • The account is completely removed from OpsNow.
  • The user loses all access and must be reinvited to join again if needed.
  • Best for:
    • Offboarded employees
    • Terminated vendor or partner accounts
    • Irrecoverable security concerns
      ‚Äç

üìå Summary Table

‚Äç

üìå Regularly deactivating or removing unused accounts helps prevent unauthorized access and strengthens your organization‚Äôs overall security posture.
